repositories.name: chat-parser-rust
repositories.description: Rust-based chat parser library. The legacy Go implementation has been retired; see `archive/go/AGENTS.md` or tag `v0.7.3` for historical reference. See [plan.md](plan.md) for the migration strategy, [toaster.md](toaster.md) for the architecture, [docs/README.md](docs/README.md) for the documentation index, and [`docs/rust/chat-parser/README.md`](docs/rust/chat-parser/README.md) for crate and module guides.

repositories.name: chat-rust
repositories.description: This repository hosts a chat service implemented in Rust. The code lives in `src/` with tests in `tests/`.

repositories.name: chatrooms-rust
repositories.description: Chatrooms is a Rust gRPC server that supports the chatroom feature on Twitch. The service handles the chatrooms specific logic and uses [MaaP](https://git-aws.internal.justin.tv/chat/zuma/blob/master/app/api/maap_models.go) to store rooms and messages.

repositories.name: classifier-rust
repositories.description: Backend service that classifies Twitch whisper messages for moderation purposes.

repositories.name: dggchat-rust
repositories.description: Migration repository for the Destiny.gg chat client. The project houses a Rust crate; the legacy Go implementation has been removed from the codebase. The Rust `Session` now reconnects automatically with an exponential backoff.

repositories.name: modbot-rust
repositories.description: Modbot is an automated moderation bot implemented in Rust. Source code lives under `rust/` and includes asynchronous API and bot logic via `tokio` and `reqwest`. See `plan.md` for goals and `toaster.md` for architecture.

repositories.name: overrustlelogs-rust
repositories.description: A chat log suite for [Destiny.gg](https://www.destiny.gg/bigscreen) and [Twitch.tv](http://twitch.tv).

repositories.name: protobuf-rust
repositories.description: Repository guidelines live in `AGENTS.md`.

repositories.description: Pubsub Edge manages persistent connections to first- and third-party clients to receive realtime updates sent from Twitch services. See the [Pubsub Docs](https://git.xarth.tv/twitch/docs/tree/master/pubsub) for more details.

repositories.name: pubsub-control-rust

repositories.name: pubsub-load-generator-rust

repositories.name: chat-gui-typescript
repositories.description: - Node.js

repositories.name: dgg-chatbot-javascript
repositories.description: See [CHANGELOG](CHANGELOG.md) for version history, [toaster](toaster.md) for architecture, [AGENTS](AGENTS.md) for contribution guidelines, [docs](docs/README.md) for component guides, and [plan](plan.md) for goals and risks. Source lives in `lib/` and `index.ts` as TypeScript and compiles to `dist/`. Chat utility helpers under `lib/chat-utils` offer typed parsing and formatting utilities, message routing classes in `lib/message-routing` handle typed chat and command dispatch, command helpers in `lib/commands` expose typed execution context and output structures, and command implementations in `lib/commands/implementations` are authored in TypeScript. Metrics reporters in `lib/services/metrics` provide a shared `MetricReporter` interface and typed metric names.

repositories.name: dgg-overrustle
repositories.description: Rust application ingesting and serving DestinyGG chat logs. The project was completely rewritten from Go to Rust, and active development now lives in a Cargo workspace defined at the repository root (`Cargo.toml`) with crates under `rust/` and `tool/`. Go tooling has been removed; the legacy `overrustlelogs/` directory is retained only for historical reference. Rust maintenance utilities reside in `tool/`. The `common` crate now also defines a reusable `Message` struct with Avro serialization, a `new_message_from_common` helper for Avro record creation, nick list search utilities for chat events, and an async `Twitch` client for managing Twitch channels. `overrustlelogs` now renders markup with Askama templates in `rust/overrustlelogs/templates`, including table rendering examples.

repositories.name: dgg-subscriber-sync
repositories.description: Rust-based service for synchronizing Twitch subscribers with DestinyGG. A companion crate `twitchpubsub` offers both an HTTP API client for forwarding subscription data and a WebSocket client for consuming Twitch PubSub events. The `twitchscrape` crate polls Twitch APIs, handles pagination and OAuth token refresh, and diffs subscribers against DestinyGG.

repositories.name: mentions-typescript
repositories.description: This repository houses language-specific implementations of the mentions bot.

repositories.name: pubsub-typescript-client
repositories.description: This is the library to integrate with our new PubSub service.
